StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genome-Wide Association Study of Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONAUNIVERSITY OF FLORIDAVANDERBILT UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was supported by the National Institutes of Health’s (NIH) National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) under award K01HL143137 (Jason H Karnes), R01HL158686 (Jason H Karnes), and U19 HL065962 (Dan M Roden), the National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS) under award P50GM115305 (Dan M Roden). Acquisition of the cohort was supported by the IRTH (Institut pour la Recherche sur la Thrombose et l’Hémostase) and by a PHRC grant (PHRN09-YG/FRIGTIH). The study was supported by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG, German Research Foundation) Project Number 374031971–TRR240 (AG). For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for Genome-wide Association of Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia can be found here: (Journal Citation __________)(PMID __________). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia, PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-HIT-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.
